Package applicationTools

Class TimeTool

java.lang.Object
applicationTools.TimeTool
public class TimeTool extends Object
Utility class for handling time-related operations in this specific application.

      public static boolean isBusinessHours()
      Checks if the current time (in the system's default time zone) is within business hours.
      Returns:
      True if the current time is within business hours; false otherwise.

    • isBusinessHours

      public static boolean isBusinessHours(LocalDateTime localDateTime)
      Checks if the given LocalDateTime is within business hours in the Eastern Time Zone. TODO [] consolidate this into the above code and utilize constants for HQ time zone.
      Parameters:
      localDateTime - The LocalDateTime to check.
      Returns:
      True if the given time is within business hours; false otherwise.

    • setLabelToHQClock

      public static void setLabelToHQClock(javafx.scene.control.Label label)
      Sets up a label to display the current time in the Eastern Time Zone using a timeline with a 1-second interval. This uses a lambda to update the clock over each KeyFrame-interval.
      Parameters:
      label - The Label to update with the current time.

    • setLabelToClock

      public static void setLabelToClock(javafx.scene.control.Label label)

      Parameters:
      label - The Label to update with the current time.

    • formatZonedDateTime

      public static String formatZonedDateTime(ZonedDateTime zonedDateTime)
      Formats the given ZonedDateTime as a string using a custom date-time formatter.
      Parameters:
      zonedDateTime - The ZonedDateTime to format.
      Returns:
      The formatted string with MMM dd, yyyy hh:mm:ss a
